page.title: 08Employment
page.content: Most people live and work on the land, but the area also has industries which support the farmer. ie blacksmith, fencer, dyker and joiner. The blacksmith, Mr Halliday, was interviewed, and revealed that the smithy was established about 80 years ago. Then its main job was to shoe the many working horses, and to mend the ploughs. In the beginning it was a one man business, but now there are six men, plus one apprentice. The raw materials come from Glasgow, Newcastle, and the Midlands. The work is rather different now, the men doing steel fabrications besides repairing farm machinery. Mr Halliday thinks that there will always be work for blacksmiths in Borgue, because there will always be farms.
